title: How to get 18 days off by taking only 9 days annual leave | Daily Mail Online
text: comments With the prospect of summer holidays still far away, the thought of a nice break from work to break up the late winter gloom seems very appealing. But if you think it's not possible because you need to save your annual leave for summer, a simple hack can help you double your days off without using up all your holiday days. Because of when Easter falls this year, you can take advantage of 18 consecutive days off by booking just nine days of annual leave. You can enjoy 18 days consecutive holiday this year with a hack that involves taking just nine days annual leave (picture posed by model) TURN NINE DAYS OFF INTO 18 Book off Tuesday 18 April to Friday 28 April, using nine days of annual leave. Because of Easter your last day in the office will be Thursday 13 April, the day before Good Friday. You won't return until Tuesday 2 May because of early Bank Holiday, meaning you'll have enjoyed 18 consecutive days off. The trick is to take advantage of the fact that the Easter break falls so close to the first May bank holiday. You can begin your holiday on 14 April, which is Good Friday and then book Tuesday 18 April to Friday 28 April off work. RELATED ARTICLES
